TopicTitle: I'm starting a new Career. What solar system mods should I use?

Articles.Content:
I want to keep the stock system, revamping is fine. I was thinking Maybe JNSQ, or maybe Stock with rescale, or maybe just stock. I'm open to any other's, though. Also, which life support?

Edited July 14, 2021 by TRAPPIST-1E

Stock rescale 3x planet sizes and orbits, square root 3 rotation periods, 0.5x height modifier (for a net 1.5x terrain height), and 1.25x atmosphere modifier.

That's what I use plus the addition of some of my own modded bodies and tweaks to stock bodies.

4x is good too, then the rotation period modifier is a nice even 2x ( I keep all the others at 0.5x height modifier, and 1.25x atmosphere height modifier).

Getting much bigger than that makes getting to orbit quite tedious, and then you'll want part mods to get performance closer to real life rockets, and then your need to lean into the mods pretty heavy.

Stock parts are pretty well balanced for a 3 or 4x rescale though

I personally recommend Kerbalism, but it changes Science somewhat and makes a much more complex playthrough. Both together is a massive challenge!

Outer Planets Mod, unfortunately it only worked on 1.11 for me, but its not too bad because 1.12 doesnt add that much new anyways.

Maybe it works for you.
I'm gonna use stock + corelian and OPM at 3.5x rescale and TACls
